    Erik Hanson wrote:
    > IDEA 3.0 was released last week or the week before, and ...
    > Unfortunatley, the price has gone up a lot too.
    > It's $500, or $700 if you want free upgrades for a year,
    > up from $400 with free upgrades for 8 months.)

Good news : you're wrong.

it's still
  - $399 for the full version, or
  - $199 for the upgrade,
with "basic maintenance and support". (=> includes free bugfixes for 
3.0, no time limit, and access to the EAP)
More details here
   http://www.intellij.com/idea/buy.jsp

Many people - like me, and you - were initially mislead by the new 
wording of the license scheme. The annual maintenance and support is 
targeted at companies who want/need more/faster support.

With the "basic maintenance and support", you still have access to the 
support forums,  and the  EAP (Early Access Program). It is still 
running, and has already produced 2 bugfixes releases, that work with 
the standard licenses.
It should also give you access to next EAP (for the next version), that, 
I think, should start in about 2 months.

Cheer up : they are not going the JBuilder way.

Alain Ravet
